description: Works well on Sway

It's worked in wayland good but when i use .webm format, sounds don't recorded or it split sounds(.mp4 worked good.). I am using fedora 36 kde and wayland.
Also, the video quality in .webm low then .mp4 ı guess.
great app great app
This app especially works well because it is straightforward and works on Wayland, which is the biggest plus. It also goes into the theme of gnome very well, looking a lot like the screenshot tool.

It allows me to do either fullscreen, or select an area. It allows me to choose if I record my mouse pointer, desktop sound or microphone. And it does all this with an extremely simple and easy-to-use interface. The only complaint I have is the mouse can look a little sluggish in the recordings, but other than that its great.
Finally, I have found the recorder for Fedora 33 which is easy to set up and use ;) good job.
OBS is the only alternative to this, but it doesn't look native in GNOME desktop.
Thanks for making this app, it works well.
I tried recording a zoom recording, the video file had a 1 hour mark however only plays 30 secs on wayland
summary: For some reason the video file only has 30 secs in 1 hour recording

description: Very nice app. BEST APP FOR Recording screen!!
It has a GNOME-ish interface(which is a + point), but doesn't have mp4 recording export on wayland so 1 star minus for that.
Clean design, works perfectly. More settings/options would be cool

Doesn't work at all in Wayland (Fedora 33).
According to the GUI's theme it's not even using GTK3 in a proper way (not honoring my dark theme).
Don't under why it's advertised as a Wayland compatible screen recorder, but no, it doesn't work.

Highly recommended any Wayland user just go with the latest OBS Studio and save your precious time.
summary: Doesn't work at all in Wayland. Do not waste your time here

description: Works really well
This simple screen recorder works very well in wayland!
Been wanting this forever.
Simple and lightweight. One of the very few that work on Wayland. A bit more customization for audio and video formats and quality would be the best thing ever!
summary: Great on Fedora 33 and Wayland, more settings wolud be awesome

description:
Simple, easy to use, and can record videos on Wayland (GNOME's short screencasts are too short).
Just missing a few features, but they're already in development.

Works well on Wayland, but needs a pause button implemented.
Please can you add a pause button to your software if possible would make a massive difference?
summary: Works well on Wayland, but needs a pause button implemented

description: This software works fine on Wayland
Wow! It is working Fedora Wayland. Thank you. Good joob.
summary: Wow! It is working Fedora Wayland. Thank you. Good joob

description: I dig the simplicity for quick screen records. You can record areas, mouse cursor can be visible in the recording. Audio also can be included. For some reason my microphone doesn't work, but I don't use it anyway in recordings.

It is good app when it works. However, it never wants to show up on any my active screens. For some reason it wants to show up on my laptop screen which is inactive. I then have to unplug all my other screens to then find it on my laptop screen. I have to do this every time I reactivate my computer, which is incredibly annoying.
summary: Good app but for some reasons always goes off screen

description: Maybe its because I'm on clear idk.
summary: mike does'nt work, neither do system sounds

description: The only screen recorder thats works with wayland, thank you!
I love how simple it is, and I can finally record on wayland. Not to mention it is absolutely not resource heavy.
A hefty update today. Congrats you on the 2.0 version. It's a substantial upgrade from previous version. Do you have any plan to include nvenc support in a future version? I would love to have that.
It crashes all the times
It doesn't work whenever you press record it says "Screenshot portal request error" portal request failed unknown unknown. Make sure the check runtime dependecies.
features are lacking and a snippet on the top bar to enable quick record would be nice
summary: good app clean and follows same theme as gnome

description: This is no-frill Wayland compatible screen recorder for Gnome. It supports window/screen selection, include mouse, mic input etc. Does one thing very well.

My mouse pointer was not captured when recording a selection (Fedora 35, X11).
Otherwise very good, supports capturing the whole screen, a window or a selection.
summary: Did not record my mouse pointer, good otherwise

description: doesnt work on my Pindphone under Manjaro Plasma beta 9

I love the way it looks and it works perfectly. Thanks a lot to the developer

Other than that, the app works well and the countdown option is really handy.

description: The design is good, sadly it does not quite work. It sometimes messes up the sound which is really annoying and there is no way to fix it afterwards.

After selecting which window to record and then clicking the Kooha Record button; I then fiddle around with the window's content; then I click the Kooha Record button again. Neither the first or second clicking of the Record button provides any feedback. A few seconds after clicking the Record button for the second time (I assume to stop recording), the error dialog pops up saying "stream error: wrong resource type/version. In the saving location there will be a new file such as Kooha-04-07-2022-16-52-53.mp4, but the file is 0 length. I've tried all video formats but get the same result.
Clean interface records audio from all the sources simultaneously. As it's been said, straightfoward.

description:
Gnome 42 x11
All good but mouse capture isn't work
Captures video and audio, amazing!

Out of all the screen recorders I've tested in Wayland, this one works best and has no issues with the latest version of pipewire. I was able to record a decent 60 fps h264 when I installed gstreamer1-vaapi, so please try enabling hardware acceleration (can be found in the Github repo) in your system.

Only a few missing bits, like the selection of one window, but for a new project its really good and thanks that it is a thing in general. There really was something missing that is easy to use and works on wayland.
genau das, was ich schon die ganze Zeit gesucht habe. Fast perfekt.

Sehr schönes Tool! Die Bedienung ist nicht nur minimalistisch, sondern auch durchdacht und super-selbsterklärend. Die Aufnahme funktioniert 1a, kann dabei auch Audio aufnehmen, wahlweise von Lautsprecherausgabe oder Mikrofon. Für mich perfekt!
summary: sehr einfach zu bedienen, funktioniert perfekt
